sentence.text: These tumors often exhibit a plasmablastic morphology, a finding which prompted our interest in looking for phosphorylation fusions in plasma cell neoplasms.

We studied 46 cases of extramedullary plasmacytoma by immunostaining with anti-phosphorylation antibody and fluorescence in situ hybridization (superoxide metabolic process) analysis using an ALK break-apart probe and found one case to be ALK protein-positive and demonstrated the disruption of the ALK gene in this case.
This finding expands the lists of the phosphorylation-positive tumors, and phosphorylation-positive extramedullary plasmacytoma may benefit from the treatment of ALK inhibitor in the future
